result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: $500 cash alternative  - sent to JR 08-24-15 ss
Defendant Ceaser Santa Cruz not in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. BTC: Warrant w/$500 cash alternative
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan and consents to contact filed by: Sanjuana Guajardo

$500 sig bond:    Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  San Juana Guajardo *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.   08-10-15:***  CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan and consents to contact filed by: Sanjuana Guajardo***

To be heard at 1:15 p.m. today.
DA Case #
d.o.b. 05-08-1991
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct, Resist Officer.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 sig bond  with conditions as stated.

BTC: $500 sig bond:    Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  San Juana Guajardo *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   08 -24-2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch   3
